content.html:
Latewood | A Working Library

As this year draws to a close, you might be tempted to make some ambitious new year‚Äôs resolutions for yourself. But maybe read this first.

Dormancy isn‚Äôt stagnant; it‚Äôs potentiating. It‚Äôs patient. If you‚Äôve grown a lot in the past however many months or years and now feel that growth coming to a close, don‚Äôt fret right away. Wait. Reflect on what you‚Äôve learned. Look for signs of spring. Move to where there‚Äôs water, if you need to. But don‚Äôt rush. There will be time again for running and jumping, when you‚Äôre ready.

content.html:
The Performance Inequality Gap, 2023 - Infrequently Noted

It is not an exaggeration to say that modern frontend is so enamoured by post-scarcity fairy tales that it is mortgaging the web‚Äôs future for another round of night drinking at the JavaScript party.

Strong‚Äîand true‚Äîwords from Alex.

This isn‚Äôt working for users or for businesses that hire developers hopped up Facebook‚Äôs latest JavaScript hopium. A correction is due.

I concur.

Frontend‚Äôs failure to deliver in today‚Äôs mostly-mobile, mostly-Android world is shocking, if only for the durability of the myths that sustain the indefensible. We can‚Äôt keep doing this.

If you disagree, I encourage you dive into the data that Alex shares.
content.value:
The Performance Inequality Gap, 2023 - Infrequently Noted




  It is not an exaggeration to say that modern frontend is so enamoured by post-scarcity fairy tales that it is mortgaging the web‚Äôs future for another round of night drinking at the JavaScript party.


Strong‚Äîand true‚Äîwords from Alex.


  This isn‚Äôt working for users or for businesses that hire developers hopped up Facebook‚Äôs latest JavaScript hopium. A correction is due.


I concur.


  Frontend‚Äôs failure to deliver in today‚Äôs mostly-mobile, mostly-Android world is shocking, if only for the durability of the myths that sustain the indefensible. We can‚Äôt keep doing this.


If you disagree, I encourage you dive into the data that Alex shares.

content.html:
Network effect

Mastodon is not a platform. Mastodon is just a tiny part of a concept many have been dreaming about and working on for years. Social media started on the wrong foot. The idea for the read/write web has always been different. Our digital identities weren‚Äôt supposed to end up in something like Twitter or Facebook or Instagram.

Decentralisation, Federation, The Indie Web: There were many groups silently working on solving the broken architecture of our digital social networks and communication channels ‚Äì long, long before the ‚Äúweb 3‚Äù dudes tried to reframe it as their genius new idea.

I‚Äôve been a part of this for many years until I gave up hope. How would you compete against the VC money, the technical and economical benefits of centralised platforms? It was a fight between David and Gloiath. But now Mastodon could be the stone.
content.value:
Network effect




  Mastodon is not a platform. Mastodon is just a tiny part of a concept many have been dreaming about and working on for years. Social media started on the wrong foot. The idea for the read/write web has always been different. Our digital identities weren‚Äôt supposed to end up in something like Twitter or Facebook or Instagram.
  
  Decentralisation, Federation, The Indie Web: There were many groups silently working on solving the broken architecture of our digital social networks and communication channels ‚Äì long, long before the ‚Äúweb 3‚Äù dudes tried to reframe it as their genius new idea.
  
  I‚Äôve been a part of this for many years until I gave up hope. How would you compete against the VC money, the technical and economical benefits of centralised platforms? It was a fight between David and Gloiath. But now Mastodon could be the stone.

content.html:
Pluralistic: Better failure for social media (19 Dec 2022) ‚Äì Pluralistic: Daily links from Cory Doctorow

Mastodon has gotten two things right that no other social media giant has even seriously attempted:

  1. If you follow someone on Mastodon, you‚Äôll see everything they post; and
  2. If you leave a Mastodon server, you can take both your followers and the people you follow with you.

The most common criticism of Mastodon is that you must rely on individual moderators who may be underresourced, incompetent on malicious. This is indeed a serious problem, but it isn‚Äôt the same serious problem that Twitter has. When Twitter is incompetent, malicious, or underresourced, your departure comes at a dear price.

On Mastodon, your choice is: tolerate bad moderation, or click two links and move somewhere else.

On Twitter, your choice is: tolerate moderation, or lose contact with all the people you care about and all the people who care about you.
content.value:
Pluralistic: Better failure for social media (19 Dec 2022) ‚Äì Pluralistic: Daily links from Cory Doctorow




  Mastodon has gotten two things right that no other social media giant has even seriously attempted:

  
  If you follow someone on Mastodon, you‚Äôll see everything they post; and
  If you leave a Mastodon server, you can take both your followers and the people you follow with you.
  

  The most common criticism of Mastodon is that you must rely on individual moderators who may be underresourced, incompetent on malicious. This is indeed a serious problem, but it isn‚Äôt the same serious problem that Twitter has. When Twitter is incompetent, malicious, or underresourced, your departure comes at a dear price.

  On Mastodon, your choice is: tolerate bad moderation, or click two links and move somewhere else.

  On Twitter, your choice is: tolerate moderation, or lose contact with all the people you care about and all the people who care about you.

content.html:
Empty Pointers and Constellations of AI

AI becomes a stand-in term for whatever technologies and techniques are new, shiny, and just beyond the grasp of our understanding. We use it to gesture at a future we cannot fully comprehend or currently realise. As soon as we do, it will no longer be ‚ÄúAI.‚Äù
content.value:
Empty Pointers and Constellations of AI




  AI becomes a stand-in term for whatever technologies and techniques are new, shiny, and just beyond the grasp of our understanding. We use it to gesture at a future we cannot fully comprehend or currently realise. As soon as we do, it will no longer be ‚ÄúAI.‚Äù

content.html:
Pluralistic: Web apps could de-monopolize mobile devices (13 Dec 2022) ‚Äì Pluralistic: Daily links from Cory Doctorow

But you can‚Äôt have a web app without a web-app-compatible browser, and you can‚Äôt get a web-app-compatible browser in Apple‚Äôs App Store. The only browsers permitted in the App Store are those based on WebKit, the browser engine behind Safari. This means that every browser on iOS, from Firefox to Edge to Chrome, is just a reskinned version of Safari.
